title: Operation Keller: 3 LeT terrorists killed during encounter with Army in J&K's Shopian
content: Indian armed forces neutralized three Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorists in Shopian's Keller area, Jammu and Kashmir, following a search operation prompted by specific intelligence. This action follows India's declaration that future terror acts will be treated as acts of war, signaling a tougher stance against Pakistan-based groups.

title: PM Modi poses in front of S-400 missile system, sends message to Pakistan
content: Prime Minister Modi refuted Pakistan's claim of destroying India's S-400 air defense system by visiting the Adampur airbase and posing with the system. This follows Pakistan's disinformation campaign, including false videos, after India's Operation Sindoor. The Ministry of External Affairs exposed Pakistan's false claims about damaging the S-400 and BrahMos missile base.

title: Explained: How India's punitive steps will continue to hit Pakistan
content: Despite the India-Pakistan ceasefire, India's economic measures against Pakistan remain in effect. These actions, initiated after the Pahalgam attack, include the suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, impacting Pakistan's water resources and agriculture. A complete ban on direct and indirect trade further cripples Pakistan's economy by blocking $500 million in goods.

title: Pakistani hackers attacked 1.5M+ Indian sites after Operation Sindoor
content: Following the Pahalgam terror strike, Maharashtra Cyber identified seven APT groups, primarily Pakistan-allied, responsible for over 1.5 million cyber attacks targeting critical Indian infrastructure. While only 150 attacks succeeded, these groups employed malware, DDoS attacks, and misinformation campaigns. The attacks originated from Pakistan, Bangladesh, the Middle East, and Indonesia, with some successful defacements and alleged data theft.

title: Lashkar terrorists killed in J&K's Shopian: What we know about them
content: In Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian, three Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorists were killed during Operation Keller. The Rashtriya Rifles Unit acted on intelligence regarding terrorist presence. Shahid Kuttay and Adnan Shafi Dar were identified among the deceased. Kuttay was involved in attacks on tourists and a BJP Sarpanch. Dar participated in the killing of a non-local labourer.

title: CBSE results: 93.66% pass in class 10, 88.39% in class 12
content: The CBSE has declared the Class 10 and 12 results for 2025, with pass percentages of 93.66% and 88.39% respectively. Girls outperformed boys, and southern regions like Trivandrum and Vijaywada topped in both boards. Foreign schools and CWSN candidates delivered impressive performances, while over 3 lakh students scored above 90%. Despite a high number of achievers, over 1.4 lakh students in Class 10 were placed in the Compartment category, highlighting areas needing academic intervention.

title: US-China trade: Trump says he called Apple CEO after China tariff rollback and ...
content: Following a US-China trade agreement where tariffs are suspended for 90 days, President Trump claimed Apple CEO Tim Cook plans to increase US investments, potentially building more plants. This news follows reports of Apple considering iPhone price hikes, possibly linked to tariffs.

title: Tendulkar and Kohli gave India 33 years of stability at No. 4. Who next?
content: With Virat Kohli retiring from Test cricket ahead of the five-match Test series in England, the big question for Gautam Gambhir and Ajit Agarkar will be who bats at No. 4 for India in Test cricket. The position for the past three decades has been owned by Sachin Tendulkar and Virat Kohli. Now, with Virat's announcement, India will have to look for options. Timesofindia.com spoke to several experts on figuring out who can be India's next mainstay.

title: Viral video: Virat Kohli speaks for the first time since Test retirement
content: Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma visited Vrindavan Dham after Kohli's Test retirement. They sought blessings from Swami Premanand Maharaj. A video shows Kohli expressing peace with his decision. Kohli's retirement marks the end of a significant Test career. He leaves behind a legacy of runs and leadership. His influence will continue to shape Indian cricket.

title: IndiGo, Air India cancel flights to these airports - check list
content: Amidst tensions between India and Pakistan, airlines like Air India and IndiGo cancelled flights to several northern destinations on May 13th after briefly resuming services. The shutdown of 32 airports had earlier severely affected flight services, resulting in more than 300 daily flight cancellations.

title: Ads are coming to Prime Video: This is how much extra you pay for no ads
content: Amazon Prime Video in India will introduce limited advertisements starting June 17, 2025. Subscribers can opt for an ad-free experience with an additional annual fee of Rs 699 or Rs 129 monthly. This change allows Amazon to invest more in content.

title: Virat Kohli: The dressing room DJ who nailed Ishant Sharma's mimicry
content: Virat Kohli's sudden retirement from Test cricket has sent ripples through the cricketing world. Among those is his former India and Delhi teammate, Shikhar Dhawan. In an exclusive interview, Dhawan fondly recalls not just Kohli's on-field heroics but also his vibrant presence in the dressing room. From celebrating Dhawan's debut century with infectious energy to his playful mimicry of teammates like Ishant Sharma, Dhawan paints a picture of Kohli's multifaceted personality.

title: Posters of Pahalgam attack suspects surface; Rs 20 lakh bounty announced
content: Following the deadly Pahalgam terror attack on April 22, which killed 26 people, Jammu and Kashmir Police released photographs of three suspects, offering a ₹20 lakh reward for information. The TRF claimed responsibility, leading to India's Operation Sindoor targeting terrorist installations in Pakistan.

title: Exclusive: 'There's only one Tendulkar and there's only one Kohli'
content: In an exclusive interview with Timesofindia.com, former South Africa cricketer Mark Boucher goes down memory lane and recollects the time he shared the dressing room with a young Virat Kohli during his three-year stint with the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) from 2008-10. The former gloveman revealed how he helped Kohli hone his technique against short-pitched bowling and explained why his eagerness to learn and aggressive mindset laid the foundation for his stellar career.

title: CBSE Class 10 result declared at cbse.gov.in with 93.66% pass rate
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has declared the Class 10th Results for 2025, with a national pass percentage of 93.66%. The Prayagraj region saw a decline, with a pass percentage of 91.01%, dropping to 15th place. Students can check their results on official CBSE websites or access digital marksheets through DigiLocker, UMANG app, and SMS-based services.

title: Ferozepur woman injured in Pakistani drone attack dies; first civilian casualty in Punjab
content: Sukhwinder Kaur, 50, has died from injuries sustained in a drone attack in Khai Pheme Ke village, Ferozepur. She succumbed to her injuries at DMC hospital. Her husband, Lakhwinder Singh, is currently admitted at DMC, while their son, Monu, is receiving treatment at a private hospital in Ferozepur. The family sustained injuries in the drone attack, prompting medical intervention.

title: Infosys employees brace for lower bonus payouts; here’s why
content: Infosys employees face reduced performance bonuses for the quarter ending March 2025 due to decreased profits, amidst industry uncertainty. While salary revisions occurred in February, net profits declined by 11.7%

title: Pollachi rape-blackmail case: All you need to know about 2019 scandal
content: In the 2019 Pollachi sexual assault case, all nine accused were sentenced to life imprisonment until death by a Coimbatore court. The Tamil Nadu government has been directed to provide Rs 85 lakh in compensation to the eight survivors. The case, involving widespread sexual assault and blackmail, triggered public outrage and statewide protests, highlighting violence against women and digital exploitation.

title: Kohli visits Vrindavan with Anushka Sharma just day after test retirement
content: Following his surprising Test retirement announcement, Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma were seen in Vrindavan, seeking a peaceful break. They visited their spiritual guide, Premanand Maharaj, after Kohli's major decision to step away from Test cricket. Anushka shared a heartfelt tribute, celebrating his strength and evolution, hinting at travel plans for the couple's future.

title: Border tension spurs Hyderabad missile firms to fast-track supplies
content: Following Operation Sindoor, the Indian government is expediting missile production. Manufacturers in Hyderabad are working to quickly deliver critical systems for missiles like BrahMos and Akash. The Defence Ministry is also engaging with drone and anti-drone tech companies to enhance capabilities. Commanders have procurement rights to address vulnerabilities, especially aerial threats.

title: 'Virat ko chhod do, dusre bhai ko padha likha lo': The making of Kohli
content: Atul Wassan recalls a young Virat Kohli's early days, recognizing his special talent at age 12. Wassan nurtured Kohli, selecting him for Ranji Trophy. Kohli's impact on cricket is undeniable, similar to legends like Hayden and Gilchrist. After retiring from Test cricket, Kohli aims to enjoy life, focusing on IPL and potentially the Olympics, prioritizing family and personal fulfillment.

title: India-Pak tensions: Tharoor lists 4 reasons why Trump’s remarks are 'disappointing'
content: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has strongly criticized Donald Trump's remarks on India-Pakistan tensions, deeming them 'deeply disappointing.' Tharoor argues Trump's stance risks reversing diplomatic progress by equating victim and perpetrator, offering Pakistan an unearned negotiating framework, internationalizing the Kashmir issue, and re-hyphenating India and Pakistan.

title: Man arrested after fire at UK PM Keir Starmer’s home in London
content: A 21-year-old man has been arrested in London. He is suspected of arson. The fire occurred at a property linked to British Prime Minister Keir Starmer. The incident took place early Monday. The London Fire Brigade responded promptly. The fire caused damage to the entrance. Investigations are ongoing. Starmer's spokesperson thanked the emergency services. Further comments will be provided later.

title: Official vs unofficial websites to check CBSE class 10, 12 results
content: As CBSE prepares to declare the 2025 Class 10 and 12 results, students are advised to use only official platforms like cbse.gov.in, results.cbse.nic.in, DigiLocker, UMANG, SMS, and IVRS. The article outlines how to access results securely, highlights risks of unofficial portals, and provides step-by-step instructions for safe result checking. It also explains CBSE’s digital infrastructure and stresses the importance of avoiding fake sites during high-traffic periods.

title: CA gives major update on players unwilling to return to India for IPL
content: The Indian Premier League is set to resume on May 17. Cricket Australia is backing players who opt out due to safety concerns. The World Test Championship final is approaching soon. Several key Australian players are involved. Coaches and commentators are also considering their return. The IPL's resumption will be closely monitored for both cricket and player safety.

title: 'Bullying & tyranny will only isolate oneself': Xi after US-China reach trade deal
content: In a veiled critique of the United States, Chinese President Xi Jinping condemned bullying and trade wars, emphasizing collaboration for global stability. This statement followed a US-China agreement to lower tariffs after a period of escalating duties. The US will reduce tariffs on Chinese imports to 30%, while China will lower duties to 10%.

title: Meet the IAF personnel who played a key role in Operation Sindoor
content: India's robust air defence system successfully thwarted numerous missile and drone attacks launched by Pakistan, ensuring the nation's security. Operation Sindoor highlighted the crucial role of the Integrated Air Command and Control System. PM Modi acknowledged the air defence system's effectiveness in intercepting and destroying Pakistani threats aimed at civilian targets, exposing Pakistan's actions to the world.

title: Operation Sindoor: Turkish drones to Chinese missiles, India beat them all
content: India's integrated air defense network successfully thwarted Pakistani aerial attacks, including Turkish drones and Chinese missiles, during recent hostilities. Military officials showcased evidence of Pakistan's use of advanced weaponry, most of which were intercepted. The robust AD system, incorporating indigenous weapons like Akash, ensured the safety of Indian airspace and military installations.

title: ‘You should be embarrassed’: Trump snaps at reporter over Qatari jet question
content: Donald Trump defended the potential acquisition of a $400 million jet from Qatar for the Department of Defense, dismissing concerns about it being a personal gift. He rebuked a reporter questioning the deal, likening it to accepting a 'gimme' in golf.

title: 'Dance of the Hillary': Guard your data, cops warn of Pak virus onslaught
content: Indian intelligence agencies have discovered a Pakistan-linked cyber-attack campaign, distributing malware named 'Dance of the Hillary' through social media platforms like WhatsApp and Facebook. This malware, spread via video or document files, steals sensitive user data and enables remote device control. Punjab Police issued a cyber alert, urging vigilance against suspicious links to protect personal and national security.

title: At least 14 dead after consuming spurious liquor in Amritsar
content: Tragedy struck Amritsar as at least 17 people died and several others were hospitalized after consuming spurious liquor in villages under the Majitha block. Authorities have launched a probe, detaining five individuals and registering two FIRs. Raids are underway to apprehend more manufacturers, with officials providing assistance to affected families and working to prevent further casualties.

title: Gold prices dip Rs 6,500 per 10 gm; MCX gold June futures at around Rs 92,975/10 gm
content: Gold prices on MCX have plummeted to Rs 92,975/10 grams, a significant drop from its recent peak, due to easing geopolitical tensions and a strengthened dollar. Silver, however, showed resilience, trading higher at Rs 96,287/kg.

title: Barca push the knife further into Madrid, inch closer to 28th La Liga title
content: Barcelona beat Real Madrid 4-3 on Sunday and went seven points clear at the top of La Liga and within touching distance of a 28th league title. They're now on the verge of doing a domestic double. Or treble if you also include the Spanish Super Cup.

title: Arnold Schwarzenegger's son opens up on weight loss journey
content: Christopher Schwarzenegger, Arnold's son, revealed his weight loss journey. He spoke about his struggles since high school. He mentioned insecurities about his weight. He cut out bread during Lent. He lost 30 pounds in two months. He still feels he has more to go. He shared this at an event in Los Angeles. Others like Kelly Osbourne and Jeff Beacher were also present.

title: Feeling the heat? It might be aging you faster than you think
content: A recent study reveals that extreme heat accelerates biological aging, particularly in older adults. Researchers found a correlation between living in areas with more days of extreme heat and increased biological age, comparable to the effects of smoking. Staying hydrated, seeking cooler environments, and checking on vulnerable individuals are crucial for mitigating the health hazards of heatwaves.

title: Nifty50 tanks below 24,700; BSE Sensex dips over 700 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, tanked in trade on Tuesday a day after an over 3.5% rally. While Nifty50 went below 24,600, BSE Sensex was below 81,200.

title: ‘Influenced by tantrik’, woman throws 2-year-old ‘possessed’ son into canal
content: In a incident, a 35-year-old woman, allegedly under the influence of an occult practitioner, has been arrested for throwing her two-year-old son into a canal in Faridabad. Authorities are currently searching for the child's body. The woman's husband revealed she believed their son was possessed, influenced by the occultist's claims, leading to this tragic event.

title: Air India cancels flight operations at 8 locations; issues advisory
content: Air India and Indigo have announced the cancellation of flight operations to and from several locations, including Jammu, Leh, Jodhpur, Amritsar, and Chandigarh, for today, May 13th. This decision was made in light of recent developments and with passenger safety as the top priority. Air India is closely monitoring the situation and will provide updates as they become available.

title: Operation Sindoor: Armed forces used wide range of space assets, both Indian and foreign
content: During Operation Sindoor, Indian armed forces utilized a range of domestic and international space assets, including Cartosat and Risat satellites, alongside commercial data from Maxar. ISRO facilitated repeatable data and plans to launch EOS-09 or Risat-1B on May 18, enhancing surveillance with all-weather, high-resolution imagery.

title: Kohli's Ranji coach drops bombshell: 'He was preparing for England Tests'
content: Virat Kohli's recent Test retirement shocked the cricketing world, including his former coach Sarandeep Singh, who revealed Kohli was actively preparing for the upcoming England series and showed no prior indications of stepping down. Singh mentioned Kohli's eagerness to replicate his 2018 success in England, making his sudden exit unexpected, especially with the crucial Test series against England approaching.

title: Virat Kohli memes break internet as fans speculate on his ODI retirement
content: Virat Kohli's sudden Test retirement has sparked a frenzy of reactions online, with fans sharing tributes and speculations about his ODI future. Having already retired from T20s, it's widely assumed the 2027 Cricket World Cup could be his last appearance. His coach, Rajkumar Sharma, lauded Kohli's Test career and hopes for ODI success.

title: Virat Kohli announces test retirement; Avneet Kaur cheers him on
content: Avneet Kaur's recent public support for Virat Kohli has sparked renewed interest online. Following Kohli's Test cricket retirement announcement, Avneet was seen enthusiastically cheering for him alongside Munawar Faruqui and Shehnaaz Gill. This comes after a brief social media stir caused by Kohli's accidental 'like' on one of Avneet's pictures, which he later clarified.

title: Tatum carried off in Celtics' Game 4 loss; MRI next
content: Celtics star Jayson Tatum will have an MRI on Tuesday after suffering an apparent noncontact lower leg injury late in the fourth quarter of Boston's Game 4 loss to the Knicks on Monday night.

title: Curry (hamstring) doesn't expect to play Game 5
content: Warriors star Stephen Curry, who is rehabbing a Grade 1 left hamstring strain, does not expect to be available for Game 5 on Wednesday, he told Andscape's Marc J. Spears.

title: Mavericks win NBA draft lottery with 1.8% odds
content: The Dallas Mavericks won this year's NBA draft lottery, earning the right to land projected No. 1 pick Cooper Flagg.

title: Yanks' Cabrera taken off in ambulance after slide
content: Yankees third baseman Oswaldo Cabrera injured his left ankle when he reached back for the plate on an awkward slide Monday night in Seattle.

title: Brunson reminds Knicks 3-1 'nothing to celebrate'
content: As the Knicks took a commanding 3-1 series lead on the Celtics and moved to within a win of their first Eastern Conference finals appearance in 25 years, captain Jalen Brunson was quick to remind his teammates, "It's nothing to celebrate."

title: Sources: Kings expected to name Holland next GM
content: Ken Holland, who won four Stanley Cups as a Detroit Red Wings executive and helped lead the Edmonton Oilers to a runner-up finish last season, is expected to become general manager of the Los Angeles Kings, sources told ESPN Monday, confirming a report.

title: NCAA prez is open to Trump's idea of commission
content: NCAA president Charlie Baker said Monday he was "up for anything" when asked about the idea of a commission on collegiate athletics, an idea proposed by President Donald Trump.

title: Chiefs superfan gets 32 years for Okla. robbery
content: Chiefs superfan Xaviar Babudar was sentenced in an Oklahoma courtroom Monday to 32 years in prison, two and a half years after authorities caught him in the state as he fled from a local bank robbery.

title: 📈 Tiering who can swing a Giannis blockbuster
content: For the first time in his career, the two-time MVP is reportedly open to a trade. How ready is every team to swing a deal?

title: Two-round NBA mock draft: Predicting all 59 picks post-lottery, with risers and fallers
content: With the Mavericks winning the lottery and the right to draft Cooper Flagg, here's ESPN's updated two-round mock.

title: 10 moves that shaped the WNBA offseason -- and what they mean for 2025
content: Seven head coaching changes. Veterans on the move. Teams rebuilding. Here's a rundown of the key developments.

title: Ranking the top 25 WNBA players
content: How do A'ja Wilson, Napheesa Collier, Breanna Stewart and Caitlin Clark stack up in our preseason rankings?

title: PGA Championship tier rankings: From Scottie and Rory to just happy to make the cut
content: Can Rory McIlroy win his second major of the year? Which LIV golfers can contend? We break down the PGA Championship at Quail Hollow (Starts Thursday on ESPN/ESPN+).

title: Ranking non-Round 1 rookies who could star this NFL season: 10 on offense, 10 on defense
content: We picked out players chosen on Days 2-3 of the 2025 draft who could contribute right away, including Saints QB Tyler Shough.

title: If anyone can bring the World Cup back to Brazil in 2026, it's Ancelotti
content: The worst-kept secret is out: Carlo Ancelotti is going to be the new Brazil manager. His task -- winning a first World Cup for the Selecao since 2002 -- isn't an easy one, but if anyone can do it, Ancelotti can.

title: Barcelona win fourth Clásico and close on LaLiga, Chelsea lose top-four clash, more
content: Barcelona made it four wins in four games against rivals Real Madrid this season, taking a big step toward winning LaLiga in the process. Also, Chelsea's top-four hopes took a self-inflicted hit vs. Newcastle.

title: The VAR Review: Why Jackson was sent off for an elbow but Mings escaped
content: How did Aston Villa's Tyrone Mings escape a red card yet Chelsea striker Nicolas Jackson was sent off?

title: Brazil announce Ancelotti as new head coach
content: Carlo Ancelotti will be the first foreign coach of Brazil, the CBF announced on Monday. However, Real Madrid are yet to confirm his exit from the club.

title: Mascherano: Everything not 'fine' at Inter Miami
content: Inter Miami CF coach Javier Mascherano has stated that "there are things that need to be corrected" following a poor run of form and 4-1 defeat to Minnesota United on Saturday.

title: Sources: Alonso close to being named Madrid boss
content: Real Madrid are finalising a deal for Xabi Alonso to become their new coach as soon as possible, multiple sources have told ESPN, with the club keen to have him in place for this summer's Club World Cup.

title: Bundesliga champ Kane: What will they say now?
content: Harry Kane has brushed off the criticism he has received during his wait for his first career trophy, saying "we'll see what people talk about now."

title: Wrexham to play July friendlies in Australia, NZ
content: Wrexham AFC will play three A-League clubs as part of a preseason friendly tour across Australia and New Zealand in July.

title: 15,000 'violent' Argentine fans banned from CWC
content: Argentine Security Minister Patricia Bullrich handed the United States Embassy in Buenos Aires on Monday a list of 15,000 violent soccer fans who will be banned from stadiums during the upcoming Club World Cup.

title: France aims to copy Premier League finance model
content: French football intends to have its own version of the Premier League, with a club-owned entity replacing the Ligue de Football Professionnel (LFP) as part of plans announced by French Football Federation president Philippe Diallo on Monday.

title: Fight grades: Could Montreal end up as one of the top PPVs of 2025?
content: UFC 315 wasn't the biggest card of the year on paper, but the fights were entertaining minus one blemish.

title: Olney: The X factors defining this year's trade deadline
content: Breaking down the the themes that will shape the 2025 deadline and the teams that could be a part of it.

title: Impact freshmen and talented transfers: These teams have the best groups of newcomers for 2025
content: Building a roster isn't just about recruiting. Combining prep talent with great transfers is key in college football and these teams did it best.

title: The biggest questions after a wild first week of the second-round series
content: The biggest questions and what to watch for after an exciting start to the second round of the 2025 NBA playoffs.

title: MLS Power Rankings: Minnesota routs Miami to climb the order
content: After rocking Miami 4-1, Minnesota is closing in on the Herons in the top 10 of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Delap to choose Man United over Chelsea
content: Manchester United have moved ahead of Chelsea in the race to sign Liam Delap. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Betting the Eurovision Song Contest: How European sportsbooks navigate Europe's most popular betting niche
content: The annual Eurovision Song Contest is this week. Doug Greenberg takes a look at some of the most popular bets.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Story Of '3 Brothers' And Why Azerbaijan Is Cheering For Pakistan
content: One has heard of friends with benefits. But in India's case, there are also antagonists with benefits: Azerbaijan and Turkey, two countries whose role in the latest conflict between India and Pakistan has come into sharp focus.

title: India Pakistan Ceasefire Live Updates:  PM Modi's Speech At Adampur Airbase After Operation Sindoor
content: India Pakistan Ceasefire LIVE Updates: Operations against Pakistan have only been kept in abeyance and the future will depend on their behaviour, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday said.

title: How Pak Minister Khawaja Asif Brought Comic Relief Amid Tension On Border
content: The past week saw India and Pakistan exchange heavy fire after New Delhi launched Operation Sindoor to avenge the Pahalgam terror attack. Artillery guns screamed on the borders and the people of the two countries argued on social media

title: "Utterly Ludicrous": British TV Host Schools Pak Podcaster
content: Islamabad was left red-faced on foreign television as British TV host Piers Morgan schooled a Pakistani podcaster over his claim on state-sponsored terrorism and the circumstances surrounding the elimination of 9/11 mastermind Osama bin Laden.

title: "Planetary Threat": Scientists Exploring How To Beat Heat For Better Sleep
content: "Rising temperatures induced by climate change and urbanisation pose a planetary threat to human sleep, and therefore health, performance, and wellbeing," according to a 2024 review of scientific literature published in the journal Sleep Medicine.

title: RFK Jr Slammed For Swimming In Sewage-Filled Rock Creek With Grandchildren
content: For a day out with grandchildren, the former presidential candidate Robert F Kennedy Jr chose Washington's Rock Creek, despite enormous evidence of its water being contaminated with harmful bacteria.

title: China Lifts Ban On Boeing Imports After Trade Talks With US: Report
content: China has lifted a ban on domestic airlines accepting new Boeing aircraft, a report said Tuesday, after Beijing and Washington agreed to temporarily lower tariffs in a major de-escalation of their trade war.

title: 9 Malaysian Paramilitary Officers Killed In Truck-Lorry Crash
content: At least nine members of a Malaysian paramilitary force were killed on Tuesday when their transport truck collided with a lorry, emergency services and media said.

title: "If Pak Is Tolerated...": Baloch Rebels Statement On Latest Attacks
content: The Baloch Liberation Army (BLA) has claimed responsibility for 71 "coordinated attacks" at more than 51 locations across Pakistan's Balochistan province under its ongoing 'Operation Herof'.

title: Outgoing Chief Justice Was Asked About Judge In Cash Row. His Reply
content: Chief Justice of India (CJI) Sanjiv Khanna on Tuesday said a court is required to assess "both the plus and minus arguments" in a case before arriving at a conclusion.

title: French Actor Gerard Depardieu Found Guilty In Sexual Assault Case
content: A court in Paris on Tuesday found French actor Gerard Depardieu guilty of sexually assaulting two women on a film set in 2021 and handed him an 18-month suspended prison sentence.

title: Monsoon Reaches South Bay Of Bengal, Nicobar Islands: Weather Office
content: The southwest monsoon advanced into parts of the south Bay of Bengal, south Andaman Sea, Nicobar Islands and some areas of the north Andaman Sea on Tuesday, the India Meteorological Department said.

title: "Some Personal Data Has Been Taken": UK's Marks And Spencer On Cyber Attack
content: British retailer Marks and Spencer said on Tuesday some personal customer information was taken in the cyber attack that has crippled its online operation for more than three weeks.

title: Life Sentence For 9 Convicts In Tamil Nadu's 2019 Pollachi Sex Assault Case
content: Six years after nine men were accused of sexually assaulting and blackmailing several women in Tamil Nadu'sPollachi, a court has pronounced them guilty. Sessions court Judge R Nandhini Devi found the men guilty of gangrape and repeated rape.

title: "India Is Eternally Grateful": PM Modi Visits Soldiers At Adampur Airbase
content: Adampur was among the air force stations that Pakistan attempted to attack after India's "Operation Sindoor".

title: Chief Justice Sanjiv Khanna Retires With A Message Mentioning His Successor
content: Chief Justice of India Sanjiv Khanna bid farewell to his colleagues at the Supreme Court this morning as he passed on the baton to Justice BR Gavai.

title: Fentanyl Is A US Issue, Says China, Calls Punitive Tariffs Unreasonable
content: The responsibility of tackling the fentanyl issue in the United States lies within the US itself, China's foreign ministry said on Tuesday, rejecting the punitive tariffs Washington imposed on Beijing for not stemming the inflow.

title: "Told To Use More Baby Oil": Escort Testifies In Sean 'Diddy' Combs Sex Trafficking Case
content: The escort detailed multiple graphic encounters with Sean 'Diddy' Combs and singer Cassie Ventura, as part of the music mogul's ongoing trial for sex trafficking and racketeering charges.

title: Kim Kardashian To Testify In Paris Multi-Million-Dollar Robbery Trial
content: A-list celebrity Kim Kardashian is to testify in a Paris court on Tuesday, an eagerly awaited appearance nearly a decade after masked men robbed her at gunpoint of millions of dollars of jewellery during the French capital's fashion week.

title: Chan Chan, UNESCO World Heritage Site In Peru, Defaced With Obscene Graffiti
content: A vandal defaced Chan Chan, a UNESCO World Heritage Site in northern Peru, with obscene graffiti over the weekend, the Ministry of Culture said Monday.

title: 'Not just terrorists camps, but Pak’s audacity was destroyed': PM at Adampur airbase
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: Madrid crisis deepens as Vini Jr. injury confirmed
content: Carlo Ancelotti will leave real madrid at the end of the season to take charge of the brazilian national team . ancelotti has been diagnosed with a sprain in his left ankle, the club said . he will take charge from may 26 when the laLiga season concludes .

title: Takeaways: Knicks take a commanding 3-1 lead
content: the second round of the 2025 playoffs is here . the no. 4 seed Indiana Pacers kicked off the East semis by taking a 2-0 lead over the No. 1 seed Cleveland Cavaliers . lopsided game 4 win gave the team a 3-1 series lead in the series .

title: Multiple divisions in flux after welterweight, women's flyweight title fights
content: Jack Della Maddalena stuns Belal Muhammad in the main event of the welterweight championship at UFC 315 . Valentina Shevchenko began her second career title defense and once again proved she is one of the greatest MMA fighters ever . Makhachev is the no. 1 pound-for-pound fighter in 2025 .

title: College baseball Week 13: Top 25 rankings and what to watch
content: the LSU Tigers are back at No. 1 after the way they played on the road against the Arkansas Razorbacks . last week's top team the Texas Longhorns dropped a couple spots after losing its series to the Florida Gators . the Gators have managed to climb back in the top 25 at no. 23 .

title: Watch: Who is Justice B.R. Gavai, the new Chief Justice of India?
content: Justice Gavai will become only the second Dalit Chief Justice of India, after Justice KG Balakrishnan

title: Special cell to approve high-rise building plans within 72 hours in A.P.
content: The newly formed cell will process development permissions for projects comprising 12 floors or more,  within Service Level Agreement (SLA) of 72 hours

title: A.P. govt. initiates restructuring of State-run schools to optimise infrastructure, personnel
content: The objective of the restructuring is to improve learning outcomes of children studying in Government schools

title: ‘Savukku’ Shankar moves Madras HC seeking CBI probe into alleged scam in manual scavenging eradication schemes
content: His PIL plea is expected to be listed before Justices G.R. Swaminathan and M. Nirmal Kumar on Wednesday

title: ‘Overwhelmed, successor Justice Gavai will uphold Supreme Court’s values’: CJI Sanjiv Khanna demits office
content: The CJI called Justice Gavai his “biggest support” while expressing confidence in the latter’s leadership and commitment to constitutional values

title: Five teams formed to solve holy books burning case in Belagavi
content: MLA Asif (Raju) Sait, who submitted a memorandum to the officers along with the protesters, sought strict action claiming that such incidents had occurred in the past as well and the police had failed to act against the offenders.

title: Goa is not lab for BJP's experiments, says Congress on Centre's suggestion about nuclear plant
content: Union Minister for Power, Housing and Urban Affairs Manohar Lal Khattar said that the Central government has suggested that the states examine the feasibility of setting up nuclear power plants in their respective areas and send proposals

title: Marginal hike in fuel prices in Kolkata
content: A readjustment in the basic price of fuel has pushed the petrol price in the city to ₹ 105.41 per litre and diesel to ₹ 92.02 per litre from May 12, 2025

title: Order blocking YouTube channel ‘4PM’ withdrawn, Supreme Court told
content: “They have withdrawn the blocking order,” senior advocate Kapil Sibal, appearing for the petitioner, informed a Bench of Justices B.R. Gavai and Augustine George Masih

title: Four killed, three injured in tragic road accident near Sivapuram in Andhra Pradesh
content: The accident occurred around 9:30 am when a coconut-laden lorry heading from Markapuram to Vinukonda collided head-on with a Bolero Max vehicle in which the victims were travelling.

title: Avoid India Gate: Delhi traffic police issues advisory for Tiranga Shaurya Samman Yatra
content: Delhi Traffic Police advisory warns of heavy congestion and diversions due to planned Tiranga Shaurya Samman Yatra near India Gate

title: Nanthancode murder case: Cadell Jeansen Raja sentenced to life for brutal killings of his family in 2017
content: Court also imposes fine of ₹15 lakh. If recovered, amount is to be paid as compensation to his uncle, Jose, the prime witness in the case

title: When Nizam-era Hyderabad ensured pilgrimage parity
content: The Service Rules were ammended, officially granting Hindu employees six months of leave with advance salary to undertake religious yatras

title: CBSE results: Tamil Nadu registers 98.48% pass rate in Class 12, 99.86% in Class 10
content: The CBSE Class 12 and Class 10 results were announced on Tuesday (May 13, 2025), with the national pass percentage recorded at 88.39% and 93.6%, respectively

title: Two crude bombs recovered from field in Kerala's Kannur
content: Explosives found by landowner while cleaning the property with workers. Bombs were discovered under a coconut tree

title: CBSE Class 10 results: Thiruvananthapuram, Vijayawada top with 99.79% pass rate
content: Thiruvananthapuram region, comprising Kerala and Lakshadweep, registers pass percentage of 99.79, marginally up from 99.75 last year

title: Partially correct picture on Kerala’s financial status being spread, says CM Pinarayi Vijayan
content: Pinarayi Vijayan says those supposed to portray a clear picture about the State are not doing their job to protect their own vested interests

title: PM Modi visits Adampur air base, says India ‘eternally grateful’ to armed forces
content: Mr. Modi’s visit to Adampur air base in Punjab comes after days of intense conflict between India and Pakistan following Indian strikes in terror sites in the neighbouring country on May 7 under Operarion Sindoor.

title: CBSE board Class 12 exam results 2025 are out: How to check?
content: The students who participated in the Class 10 and Class 12 exams can access their results in these websites

title: Hyderabad’s RGIA dismisses viral video about terrorist movement as misleading, says footage is from mock drill
content: The airport officially clarified that the visuals seen in the video were from a mock drill conducted as part of routine preparedness measures in light of the ongoing security situation

title: Mundra port drug haul: SC dismisses bail plea of Delhi-based businessman
content: The Bench termed the allegation of terror financing against Talwar as premature and directed the special court to list the matter twice in a month for expeditious conclusion of trial in the case.

title: Kerala Police rule out theft in ‘lost and found’ gold rod from Sree Padmanabhaswamy temple
content: Last week, temple authorities reported missing the alloy rod used for soldering and welding at temple. This caused a public furore, with initial media reports suggesting that the temple had lost a religious artefact

title: CBSE Class 12 results: Thiruvananthapuram region slips to second position
content: The region, comprising Kerala and Lakshadweep, registers a pass percentage of 99.32, 0.28 percentage points less than Vijayawada

title: Five Namma Clinics opened in Hubballi
content: KSDB Chairman Prasad Abbayya said that the new Namma Clinic outlets would reduce the burden on KMC-RI Hospital as good healthcare facilities and treatment would be made available in their respective localities

title: CBSE Class 10, Class 12 results declared, girls outshine boys
content: The Board informed that 88.39% students passed Class 12 board exams, marginally up from last year’s pass percentage.

title: 64 students to get gold medals, 863 candidates to receive degrees at UAS Dharwad convocation on May 14
content: The various graduate, post-graduate and doctoral degrees will be distributed during the 38th annual convocation of the University of Agricultural Sciences in Dharwad

title: AICC summons Kerala leaders in Delhi ahead of more organisational revamp to make Congress election-ready in State
content: Kerala Opposition Leader V.D. Satheesan says meeting to focus on restructuring party apparatus from DCC-level and upwards

title: Shopian encounter: Three terrorists killed, search operation still on, says Army
content: Based on a specific intelligence about the presence of terrorists in Shoekal Keller area of Shopian, the Army launched a search and destroy operation

title: Pollachi sexual assault case: Coimbatore court convicts all nine accused, sentences them to life imprisonment
content: The court found the accused guilty of all charges against them; it also ordered that the State government pay a total compensation of ₹85 lakh to eight survivors of sexual assault

title: Bettadmele breakfast: A trek that rewards you with freshly made hot dosas on top of the hills
content: Leave the madding crowd behind and head for the hills with the Suyana group which organises getaways from Bengaluru

title: At least 14 die after drinking spurious liquor in Punjab; seven held
content: Police said six people have been hospitalised with complications caused by hooch, seven people have been arrested

title: Markets drop in early trade after sharp rally in previous session
content: The 30-share BSE benchmark gauge Sensex, declined by 497.5 points to 81,932.40 in early trade. The NSE Nifty dropped 117.2  points to 24,807.50

title: Former MP Kesineni Srinivas alleges death threat, lodges complaint with Vijayawada Police Commissioner
content: Nani accuses Chakravarthy Kadiyala of making a death threat on May 11 and being hand-in-glove with MP Kesineni Sivanath in liquor scam

title: Districts Collectors in A.P. told to ensure compliance with MLAs’ protocol courtesies
content: Chief Secretary K. Vijayanand issues memo to District Collectors, after the issue was highlighted by Assembly Speaker Ch. Ayyanna Patrudu

title: Between Pahalgam attack and Operation Sindoor: India’s social media war
content: Platform X became the arena not just for India and Pakistan’s social media war, but the digital harassment of civilians who dared to voice even a slightly contrary opinion

title: Foreign Secretary Misri to brief parliamentary panel on situation with Pakistan on May 19
content: The committee's chairman and Congress MP Shashi Tharoor said that Vikram Misri will brief the panel on Monday (May 19, 2025) on the developments, which were marked by India striking terror sites in Pakistan

title: A painter’s plea for global unity through art and sport
content: Venkatesh Kandunoori’s painting depicting a woman arched in labour, birthing planet Earth, is a visual homage to a time when earth was revered as a mother

title: On differences in clientelism, patronage and freebies
content: In most political commentaries, there is a tendency to conflate these different phenomena, since there are some overlaps between these practices. However, such conflation leads to overlooking harmful relationships

title: Gurukul students shine in EAPCET
content: In Engineering stream, all 953 students from the Gurukul Society, who appeared for the test, qualified

title: Govt. data confirms massive undercount of COVID-19 pandemic deaths | Data
content: As per latest data, excess deaths in 2021 were nearly six times more than the reported COVID-19 deaths in 2021, confirming The Hindu’s analysis done for that year

title: Committed to 100% reservation in govt. jobs for locals tribals in Agency areas: A.P. CM Naidu
content: Naidu asks the officials to explore all legal avenues to reinstate G.O. No. 3 which was quashed by Supreme Court  and ensure justice to tribal population

title: Mercury goes past 41°C in 17 districts in Andhra Pradesh
content: Heatwave-like conditions may prevail in Srikakulam, Vizianagaram, Paravathipuram-Manyam and East Godavari and Kakinada districts, says APSDMA

title: Rain likely in some parts of Tamil Nadu from May 14; downpour predicted in interior and Western Ghats districts
content: Parts of Tamil Nadu and Puducherry may have to experience searing heat with temperature level likely to be two-three degree Celsius above average till May 14

title: IndiGo, Air India cancel flights to Amritsar, Jammu and other places for May 13
content: Flights are cancelled to and from Jammu, Amritsar, Chandigarh, Leh, Srinagar, and Rajkot, IndiGo said

title: Delhi HC closes case after Nishikant Dubey says he removed post against Mahua Moitra
content: Moitra claimed being aggrieved by Dubey’s post on facebook and Dehadrai’s post on X with the screenshot of Mr. Dubey’s post

title: Rain pattern and rock pool size matter for tadpole growth in Konkan’s lateritic plateau
content: Conservation of Konkan’s lateritic plateau rock pools which are home to tadpoles and other organisms are important for the ecosystem maintenance, especially in the light of climate change, where erratic rain and temperature patterns are expected

title: Government should explain why U.S. mediation was allowed, says Sharad Pawar
content: Raising concerns over third-party interference in Kashmir matters, Former Chief Minister Mr. Pawar pointed out why the principle of the Shimla Agreement was violated during the ceasefire with Pakistan

title: Drones observed along IB in Jammu's Samba, Punjab's Jalandhar; officials say situation calm now
content: Meanwhile, a senior district official in Punjab's Jalandhar said the armed forces neutralised a suspected "surveillance drone"

title: Slight rise in Telangana’s Maternal Mortality Ratio but remains lower than national average
content: Maternal Mortality Ratio is a critical health indicator that reflects the number of maternal deaths per 100,000 live births

title: As BJP govt. in Odisha nears one year in power, grievance redressal emerges as key tool to connect with people
content: Since assuming office in June last year, Chief Minister Mohan Charan Majhi has been personally overseeing grievance redressal, conducting weekly hearings at the CM’s grievance cell every Monday

title: Vadakalai, Thenkalai sects face off again during Brahmotsavam of Sri Varadharaja Perumal temple
content: Official sources in the Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowments Department, under whose control the temple is, said they held separate meetings with both groups and secured a promise that they would ensure that the festival went on without any disturbance

title: Young cricketers, fans honour king Kohli’s legacy in Kerala
content: Despite differing views on the timing of his exit, Kohli’s legacy continues to inspire next generation, with many recalling his memorable Test innings and moments of brilliance

title: T.N. Chief Minister Stalin arrives in the Nilgiris, expected to inaugurate flower show on Thursday
content: Mr. Stalin then proceeded to Udhagamandalam town where he was welcomed by party functionaries and members of the public before proceeding to the Tamizhagam government guest house where he will stay for the duration of his visit

title: Congress worker killed by Maoists in Chhattisgarh’s Bijapur
content: Maoists killed his brother six months ago, says former CM Baghel and accuses BJP govt. of failing to protect tribals

title: Staff organisation objects to ‘unlawful inspection’ at KTU
content: Forum members say inspection was conducted by the Higher Education department without the knowledge of V-C to probe a complaint by an SFI leader regarding the denial of his PhD admission

title: Odisha police deploy trained commandos at Puri Jagannath Temple ahead of Rath Yatra
content: Security measures heightened for this year’s forthcoming Rath Yatra in view of tension between India and Pakistan

title: Twenty Maoists killed in recent encounter identified: Police
content: 31 Maoists were killed in the operation that was launched on April 21 and conducted along the Karegutta hills, a senior police officer said

title: West Bengal Police cracks down on anti-India social media posts; accused arrested from many places
content: Police say such online posts were few in number but whoever made the posts were apprehended and dealt as per law

title: Need collective efforts to develop Tiruvuru Assembly constituency: Vijayawada MP
content: People need not travel to the NTR district headquarters to have their issues resolved as they could approach the officials locally under the PGRS, says Sivanath

title: Committee to be formed for amendments to Cooperative Societies Act in Maharashtra, says CM Fadnavis
content: Union Minister Gadkari recommends the formulation of a new law for the cooperative sector in the State, and suggested a detailed study to examine the socio-economic impact of the cooperative movement in the State

title: Supreme Court grants relief to man in live-in relationship
content: The court may, based on the length of such relationship and conduct of the parties, presume implied consent of the parties to be in such a relationship, the Supreme Court said

title: Modi’s address silent on Trump’s claim of U.S. averting nuclear conflict by threatening to stop trade: Congress
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh questions if India agreed to U.S. mediation and whether it will give in to U.S. demand to open up Indian markets in autos, agriculture and other areas. Meanwhile, party leader Shashi Tharoor insists the ceasefire was a bilateral agreement, says India has allowed “a certain politician to take credit”

title: Untouchability is being practised in the country in myriad ways, says Madras High Court
content: Justice D. Bharatha Chakravarthy says refusing to accept donations for a temple festival from all human beings is also untouchability
